main event: A series of blue flashes were observed moving across the horizon in Xenia, Ohio on July 6, 1963.
interesting points: The flashes were spaced about 3-5 seconds apart and lasted for about 15-20 flashes.
The flashes were similar to a flashbulb and were visible against scattered clouds.
The object was observed moving across the horizon, but no sound was heard.
The witness contacted a VP Operations from Minneapolis who was in the area over Xenia at the time.
The report concludes that the object is considered unidentified.
